channel.title: Flight 93
channel.description:
Anyone seen; http://www.watchingfreemovieonline.com/player.html?red=13176 ?
And on another note just wanted to say; R.I.P all the people involved in 9/11 shouldn't of happend. But what I don't understand is why would they want to comitt sucide because they thought they would get 72 virgins in heaven, pretty sad...
Edit; how did they get bombs and knifes through security?
discuss/watch (like i am now).

item.title: Flight 93
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

Frell:

yea they based a movie off of it… so?

The OP was about the movie, stay on topic.

m.dog311:

None of you understand how hard it actually is to fly a plane straight into the ground. There are a fuckload of fail-safes, stabilizers, etc on those airplanes. Veteran pilots would have had an extremely hard time disabling everything and putting that thing into the ground. Especially in the amount of time they had/did it in.

Yer, and I bet you know how all that works right?

Read full topic

item.title: Flight 93
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

t’wasn’t show down.

Mail Online

Flight 93 'was shot down' claims book

They are the heroes of 9/11 - the passengers killed fighting their hijackers. But a new book claims they were shot down by U.S. fighter jets...and that the whole story is a cynical cover-up

http://www.flight93crash.com/flight93_shoot_down.html

http://www.thepowerhour.com/911_analysis/flight-93-shot-down.htm

answers.yahoo.com

Was flight 93 shot down?

My dad said in the news that week of 9/11 that the news said air force shot down flight 93 because it was going to the white house

No. Flight 93 crashed 5 minutes before NEADS was even alerted that the aircraft was a hijack.

Read some of them, most say it wasn’t and was just media…

Read full topic

item.title: Flight 93
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Frell, way to listen to the government account of what happened, which may I add, completely contradicts eye witness accounts… The people who live in Shanksville say they saw flight 93 crash, then moments later saw a military plane fly away from the scene, and 2 civilian planes following it. When asked what military plane they saw, most of them identified it as the A10-Warthog. Also note that the way the plane was described to crash is the same way a plane crashes when it gets its tail shot off. Also look at the flight path of flight 93. Shanksville was the last place it could have crashed/been shot down without debris landing in highly populated areas. Honestly, if the government shot it down, they made the right choice. The people on that plane we’re dead, no matter how anyone looks at it.

Read full topic

item.title: Flight 93
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

They interviewed the lady who flew the f-16 that was ordered to shoot down 93 yesterday, she said they didn’t have time to load her jet with missiles and she only had 105 shots from her machine gun, if for some reason she missed she was ordered to ram her jet into the back of the plane (kamikaze) so it would take off the fins and cause the plane to go nose first down and the debris spread would have been minimal.

Oh and it wasn’t shot down, she (and her team that was taking off ~5 minutes after her) couldn’t find the plane and later that day they found out the passengers caused the plane to crash.

Read full topic

item.title: Flight 93
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

I actually didn’t claim any of that to myself, personally. I’m just stating that atheism is not believing god. Maybe some atheists do believe there’s a purpose, just that God(s) isn’t involved in any of it, since they don’t believe god exist.

And actually, your statement doesn’t really mean it has to be influenced by “religion” could just be simple facts.

Read full topic

item.title: Flight 93
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Let’s create a simple scenario here. Your atheism vs my Christianity.

My set of beliefs would be:
Universe was created by God
Purpose on Earth is to make it to heaven

Yours would be:
Universe created naturally, not by a supernatural being
We have no real purpose on earth outside of our lives

Both of these are directly influenced by our respective religion. Your atheism dictates what you believe about the creation of the universe and a lot more than you obviously think…

Read full topic

item.title: Flight 93
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

a set of beliefs concerning the cause, nature, and purpose of the universe, especially when considered as the creation of a superhuman agency or agencies, usually involving devotional and ritual observances, and often containing a moral code governing the conduct of human affairs.
Close enough ^

Anyone can just go make something up and call it a religion though so it’s pretty retarded.

Read full topic

item.title: Flight 93
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:63, topic:414181”]A religion is based upon how the universe was created and such[/quote]No.

Some religions include their ideas as to how it was all created. That doesn’t mean a religion is defined BY the religions of today. You can’t say whoopdie do, Christianity has all these features and stuff, and if something else doesn’t have them, it isn’t a religion.

Read full topic

item.title: Flight 93
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

A religion is based upon how the universe was created and such, and usually has a deity. Still, atheism is just not believing a deity. It doesn’t make atheism a religion. It affects my views on reality but it doesn’t make it a religion. A lot of things can do that. Finding common ground between the two is pointless.

Read full topic
